result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamsher Singh

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamsher Singh appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella appeared by video for Shamsher Singh.  Attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense received an offer from the State. Defense requests a status conference date to allow time to go over offer with his client. Court adjourns matter for a status and authorized the parties to appear by zoom. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shamsher Singh in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense received all of discovery and requested more time as both parties are close to a possible resolution.  State does not object.  Court grants defense request.  All parties to appear by zoom next court date.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shamsher Singh in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Kimberly Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defense called to reschedule the arraignment for a late morning, on the same scheduled date. Parties were advises of the changes. Clerk advised defense to inform his client if the same. Arraignment is scheduled for 6/16/22 at 10:30am.

Defendant Shamsher Singh in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Deputy R. Harris.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Arraignment scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shamsher Singh in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by zoom.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is having technical issues, is unable to appear with video. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant previously posted $75,000 cash bail. Court orders $1,500 remain on deposit and the remaining balance be returned to the remitter. 
No driving without a valid license.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NDG.

Defendant Shamsher Singh in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defense challenges probable cause as to count 1 and moves to dismiss. Arguments heard. 
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings and denies defense's motion. 
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 022718,
Payable Number: 990914,
Receipt Number: 22RP009533,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/8/22 @ 1p
